meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly to someone
meanings.sent1: She halloas her friend from across the playground.
meanings.sent2: He always halloas when he needs help.
meanings.sent3: The teacher halloas to gather the students for the field trip.
meanings.sent4: The coach halloas instructions to the players on the field.
meanings.sent5: The hiker halloas for assistance when she gets lost in the woods.

meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout to attract attention
meanings.sent1: The halloas of the crowd could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: She let out a halloas when she saw her lost dog return home.
meanings.sent3: The halloas of the children playing in the park filled the air.
meanings.sent4: His halloas echoed through the empty hallways of the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: The halloas of the protesters could be heard outside the government building.
